Key Match Events: José Alvarado pitched a scoreless inning in a 3-2 Phillies win over the Tampa Bay Rays.
Alvarado recorded three outs on seven pitches in the eighth inning.
Alvarado's seven pitches were the second-fewest he’s ever needed to pitch a full inning.
Post-Match Reflections: José Alvarado expressed his mentality of competing and not worrying about things he can't control.
Manager Rob Thomson commented on Alvarado pitching freely and looking like his old self.
Nick Castellanos praised Alvarado's confidence and ability to attack the zone.
Garrett Stubbs noted the improvement in Alvarado's cutter and its impact on his performance.
Zack Wheeler remarked on Alvarado's refreshed outlook and fantastic performance.
Alvarado reflected on the support from fans and the positive environment of being on a successful team.
